item.title: Looks Aren’t Everything? Clavicular Begs to Differ.
item.description: Braden Peters, known as Clavicular, has emerged as a beacon for a group of narcissistic, status-obsessed young men. He wants to take his fixation with “looksmaxxing” mainstream.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Bernstein
item.media:credit: Cassidy Araiza for The New York Times
item.media:description: The 20-year-old streamer goes to extremes to achieve an ideal of male beauty, but that’s not the only reason he’s become an online sensation.

item.title: Mamdani Surprises Couples at City Hall and Officiates Their Weddings
item.description: Mayor Zohran Mamdani stopped by City Hall last Thursday, stepping in to officiate weddings and shocking couples as they arrived for their appointments.
item.dc:creator: Callie Holtermann

item.title: The Objects We Keep for Love
item.description: We asked readers to share the items they’ve held on to as reminders of love. The responses ranged from uplifting and funny to heartachingly sad.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce

item.title: Rewriting the Fashion Rules at Proenza Schouler
item.description: With her first show for Proenza Schouler, Rachel Scott was trying to pull off more than a reinvention.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

item.title: Tara Lipinski and Johnny Weir Are Skating Their Way Through “The Traitors”
item.description: On “The Traitors,” two American Olympians turned skating commentators have become fan favorites by embracing the roles of lovable fools.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Roy
item.media:description: The two friends shared a candid moment at a hotel in South Korea in 2018.

item.title: How Did Pat McGrath Cosmetics Go From Billion-Dollar Brand to Bankruptcy?
item.description: The makeup artist Pat McGrath was a favorite of Taylor Swift, Kim Kardashian and Madonna. Then she became a billion-dollar brand.
item.dc:creator: Linda Wells
item.media:description: Pat McGrath in 2024.

item.title: Rachel Scott Wants to Dress the New New York Woman
item.description: Rachel Scott, the new designer of Proenza Schouler, wants to dress the city for the future — and for the world.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Daniela Spector for The New York Times

item.title: Ralph Lauren’s Not-So-Gilded Age
item.description: The designer goes hunting in the fields of style past.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman and Simbarashe Cha
item.media:description: Tweed suiting and a Braveheart shearling at Ralph Lauren.

item.title: What to Watch After Watching Marc Jacobs
item.description: A ’90s-tinged fashion show has our critic thinking about an underappreciated ’90s movie.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Theodore Conklin, 77, Dies; His Rescue of an Inn Helped Save Sag Harbor
item.description: By rehabilitating the American Hotel, he turned a hard-luck village on the East End of Long Island into a mecca for pop stars and plumbers alike.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green

item.title: Six Rising Fashion Designers Who Have Our Attention
item.description: These talents are showing their work in London, Milan or Paris.
item.dc:creator: Kin Woo

item.title: Fred Segal Has a New Owner. This Time It’s Aritzia.
item.description: The storied Los Angeles retailer, once recognized as an arbiter of West Coast style, has been acquired by the mass-market brand Aritzia.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi
item.media:description: Fred Segal founded his namesake brand in 1961 and opened its first store in Los Angeles that same year. The brand quickly gained attention with the private school set, musicians and mothers and daughters looking to splurge.

item.title: Dad, You’re (So Not) Embarrassing Me at This Concert
item.description: Across the country, dads are donning sparkly blazers and purple wigs to bond with their Gen Z and Alpha kids on their own turf, be it the Eras Tour or “KPop Demon Hunters.”
item.dc:creator: Ashley Spencer

item.title: Do You Back Into a Parking Spot or Back Out?
item.description: An exploration of what’s driving a change in America’s parking lots.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz
item.media:credit: Bryan Birks for The New York Times
item.media:description: In 2020, AAA updated its curriculum to advise drivers to back into parking spaces.

item.title: See a Museum Through Bruno Goppion’s Eyes? He’d Rather You Not.
item.description: For three generations, Bruno Goppion’s family has supplied display cases to the world’s top museums. What others look through, he can’t look past.
item.dc:creator: Sandra E. Garcia
item.media:credit: Francesca Forquet for The New York Times
item.media:description: Bruno Goppion in one of his family’s workshops outside Milan.

item.title: Brooklyn Beckham Spices Up Miami Burger Bash With His Own Hot Sauce
item.description: Amid a family spat that has kept his name in headlines, Brooklyn Beckham joined hundreds to eat burgers on a beach.
item.dc:creator: Linda Marx
item.category: South Beach Wine and Food Festival
item.media:credit: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times
item.media:description: Brooklyn Beckham, a host of the Burger Bash at this year’s Food Network South Beach Wine & Food Festival, mingled with attendees at the start of the event on Thursday.

item.title: Husbands and Boyfriends Step Into Olympic Spotlight
item.description: Here come the “HABs,” the attention-seeking husbands and boyfriends of medal-winning athletes.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola
item.media:description: The influencer Jake Paul reacts after his fiancée, the Dutch speedskater Jutta Leerdam, won the gold medal in the 1,000-meter race.

item.title: Epstein Scandal Leaves Some Young Trump Voters Feeling Betrayed
item.description: Drawn to President Trump for his pledge to take down the political elite, some of his young constituents say he has failed them.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Taylor Pemberton
item.media:credit: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times
item.media:description: As President Trump and prominent right-wing voices try to downplay the revelations of the Epstein files, some young conservatives are losing faith in the Make America Great Again movement.

item.title: A NYC Chinese Restaurant’s Lunar New Year T-Shirts Are a Coveted Collector’s Item
item.description: A New York restaurant’s Lunar New Year merchandise has become a coveted collector’s item.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Sherman and Hiroko Masuike
item.media:description: Wo Hop, which opened in Lower Manhattan in 1938, has included seasonal Lunar New Year T-shirts in its merchandise offerings since 2012.

item.title: By Day, Cortina D’Ampezzo Is an Olympic Hub. By Night, It’s a Party.
item.description: Cortina d’Ampezzo, a small Alpine town in northern Italy, is hosting much of the Winter Games. It’s also a home away from home for rich partygoers.
item.dc:creator: Jason Horowitz
item.media:credit: Alessandro Grassani for The New York Times
item.media:description: Filippo Borghi mixing a cocktail at the Hôtel de la Poste, a famous nightspot in Cortina d’Ampezzo, Italy.

item.title: They Spun a Globe on Their First Date, and Kept Their Promise
item.description: An all-day first date — and a year that tested them — led Madeline Richter and Jesse Dimitro to a wedding on Valentine’s Day.
item.dc:creator: Donna Kim

item.title: A Flirty Weekend Led to Talk of Marriage
item.description: Tara Jae and RaeShanda Lias met ahead of a Black Pride event. The two married on Valentine’s Day, with the actress Niecy Nash-Betts officiating.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: ‘You’re My Wife. You’re My Life.’
item.description: When my husband collapsed in our bedroom, it was the nightmare I had long feared, coming true.
item.dc:creator: Stefanie Gunning

item.title: A Shofar Player Wasn’t High on Her Dating Wish List
item.description: Caroline Goldfarb, a comedy writer and producer, never thought she could fall for a ram’s horn player, but that changed after she met Michael Gropper.
item.dc:creator: Rosalie R. Radomsky

item.title: In ‘Passerby,’ an Artist Documents Women’s Lives One Photo at a Time
item.description: For a decade, Clémence Polès Farhang asked women on city streets if she could take their picture. This week, the photographs had their first exhibition.
item.dc:creator: Lindsay Gellman

item.title: New York Fashion Week in 60 Seconds
item.description: Our chief fashion critic, Vanessa Friedman, reflects on New York Fashion Week.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman, Gabriel Blanco and Léo Hamelin

item.title: Lola Kirke, the Original West Village Girl
item.description: The “Sinners” actress, the youngest daughter of the Kirke family of artists, returned to New York for a combination concert-and-book tour.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Lange
item.media:credit: Jutharat Pinyodoonyachet for The New York Times

item.title: My, What Flushed Cheeks Cathy in ‘Wuthering Heights’ Has
item.description: In the new film adaptation of “Wuthering Heights,” complexion plays a role.
item.dc:creator: Annabel Nugent

item.title: At NYFW, Cool Clothing Is the Way to Brave the Winter Weather
item.description: Off and on the runways at New York Fashion Week, various outfits showcased how to to dress strikingly and cozily.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha
item.media:description: After walking in the Coach show, models bundled up in roomy coats that went well with their big runway hair.

item.title: The Complicated Politics of Rama Duwaji’s Style
item.description: The new first lady of New York City takes her place at New York Fashion Week — and in the spotlight.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:description: Rama Duwaji made an appearance this week at the Diotima fashion show.

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘I Wrote Immediately and Effusively’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: Rachel Zoe, Who Made Stylists Into Celebrities, Is Back on Reality TV
item.description: The woman who made stylists into celebrities is back where it all started — reality TV.
item.dc:creator: Max Berlinger
item.category: The Real Housewives of Beverly Hills (TV Program)
item.media:credit: OK McCausland for The New York Times
item.media:description: “She’s fun to watch, she’s aspirational and she’s opinionated,” Andy Cohen said of Ms. Zoe’s appeal to the Bravo audience.

item.title: I Receive So Many Angry Text Messages! How Can I Make Them Stop?
item.description: Sick and tired of feeling like a receptacle for others’ negative emotions, a reader is desperate to stem the tide of foul-tempered texts.
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: How to Dress for Fraud, According to HBO’s ‘Industry’
item.description: The best-dressed character on HBO’s “Industry” also happens to be its most morally compromised.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Can Love Be Addictive? Many Say Yes — and It’s Changing Our Idea of Romance.
item.description: Poems and songs say love should be world-shattering. The logic of love addiction suggests that it shouldn’t.
item.dc:creator: Sophie Haigney

item.title: At an Anti-Valentine’s Day Party, People Commiserate and Celebrate Heartbreak
item.description: On the Monday after Valentine’s Day, guests celebrated not love, but the pain of heartbreak and the cathartic relief of commiseration, at the “Ex Files” party.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta
item.media:credit: Ye Fan for The New York Times

item.title: Frederick Vreeland, Diplomat and Spy Who Served With Style, Dies at 98
item.description: A son of the influential fashion editor Diana Vreeland, he had an upbringing well suited to his overt and covert duties during the Cold War.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: Colorful and Warm Outfits
item.description: A conversation about his red coat offered glimpses of other ways the color had entered their lives.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: T-Shirts Gave Me the Education I Never Got at School
item.description: I was a nervous Gen Z kid who wanted to lead a bolder life — so I turned to clothing older than I am.
item.dc:creator: Maddie Barron
item.media:credit: Alexis Kleshik for The New York Times

item.title: ‘Brick’ It. Chain It to a Wall. How Far Would You Go to Get Away From Your Phone?
item.description: How did our relationship to our phones become so antagonistic?
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher and Adam Powell
item.media:credit: Adam Powell for The New York Times

item.title: Abe Lincoln Fans Gather for Mutton Hunks and a Vintage American Flag
item.description: An old Manhattan steakhouse is the new home for the Stars and Stripes that draped the 16th president’s casket.
item.dc:creator: Alex Vadukul and Graham Dickie
item.media:credit: Graham Dickie for The New York Times

item.title: Should I Dress Like My Younger Co-Workers?
item.description: Office attire has morphed significantly over the years. Our critic shares her thoughts on sticking to your style versus changing with the times.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman

item.title: Crotch Fabric, Blue Skin Suits and Other Mysteries of Olympic Gear
item.description: Before going for the gold, athletes at the Winter Games must check their apparel and equipment. Or else.
item.dc:creator: Scott Cacciola
item.media:description: Did the color of Jordan Stolz’s suit have anything to do with his record-setting speedskating wins?

item.title: Good News, Millennials: The Side Part Has Returned
item.description: After Gen Z’s embrace of the center part, hair appears to be migrating sideways once again.
item.dc:creator: Rory Satran
item.media:description: The singer Addison Rae showed off her side part at this year’s Grammy Awards.

item.title: Independent Spirit Awards Winners 2026: See the Complete List
item.description: Here’s who went home with an Indie Spirit Award on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.media:description: Eva Victor won the Best Screenplay award for her film “Sorry, Baby.”

item.title: See the Looks From the 2026 Independent Spirit Awards
item.description: The awards show, which celebrates independent film and television, moved back to the Hollywood Palladium for this year’s awards show.
item.dc:creator: The Styles Desk
item.media:description: Rose Byrne, winner for Best Lead Performance for “If I Had Legs I’d Kick You.”

item.title: A Speed Dating Event Where You Can Body-Slam Your Crush
item.description: At a wrestling speed dating event in Brooklyn, young people spent Valentine’s Day getting physical with strangers in hopes of finding love.
item.dc:creator: Callie Holtermann
item.media:credit: Mila De La Torre for The New York Times
item.media:description: Luiz Campos, top, and Tasneem Sarjoo tested their chemistry on the mat at a wrestling speed dating event on Saturday night.

item.title: Bicepmaxxing at Calvin Klein
item.description: The muscles were more memorable than the clothes.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Epstein Files Hint at His Ties to the Supermodel Naomi Campbell
item.description: Ms. Campbell previously claimed she was an acquaintance of the convicted sex offender. Emails shed new light on the extent of their interactions.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta and Jesse McKinley
item.media:description: Naomi Campbell modeling in a fashion show in Paris in October 2025.

item.title: On the Las Vegas Strip, Local Acts at Delilah and Elsewhere Set the Vibe
item.description: On the Strip and beyond, clubs, bars and restaurants spotlight local performers who deliver some of the city’s best entertainment.
item.dc:creator: Alex Schechter and Tag Christof
